intro: Asplundia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty spider-plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyclanthaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and striking, dark green leaves with a reddish-brown underside. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Asplundia ferruginea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
